title: Young voters’ enthusiasm for Democrats waned during midterms
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Young voters who have been critical to Democratic successes in recent elections showed signs in November's midterms that their enthusiasm may be waning, a potential warning sign for a party that will need their strong backing heading into the 2024 presidential race.

title: 2nd Oath Keepers Jan. 6 sedition trial to get underway
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — After securing seditious conspiracy convictions against two leaders of the Oath Keepers, the Justice Department will begin Monday to try to make its Capitol riot case against four others affiliated with the far-right extremist group.

title: Election nonprofit that drew GOP ire in 2020 renews grants
shortDescription: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A nonprofit group that became a point of controversy for distributing hundreds of millions of dollars in election grants during the 2020 presidential campaign is releasing a fresh round of money to local election offices, including in states where Republican lawmakers tried to ban the practice.

title: Biden aims to narrow trust gap with US-Africa leaders summit
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden is set to play host to dozens of African leaders in Washington this week as the White House looks to narrow a gaping trust gap with Africa — one that has grown wider over years of frustration about America's commitment to the continent.

title: Shreveport elects its first Republican mayor in 28 years
shortDescription: SHREVEPORT, La. (AP) — Voters in Louisiana's third-largest city have elected a Republican mayor for the first time in 28 years.Tom Arceneaux, 71, won a runoff election Saturday to become the next mayor of Shreveport.

title: Biden called gay marriage ‘inevitable’ and soon it’ll be law
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — A decade ago, then-Vice President Joe Biden shocked the political world and preempted his boss by suddenly declaring his support for gay marriage — one of the country's most contentious issues — on national television.

title: Democrat Bass takes charge as LA mayor amid homeless crisis
shortDescription: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Karen Ruth Bass, a former physician assistant who shattered glass ceilings with her rise to a leadership post in the California legislature and later a prominent spot in Congress, took a ceremonial oath of office Sunday as mayor of Los Angeles.

title: Sinema party switch highlights 2024 obstacles for Democrats
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — Less than three days after Democrats celebrated victory in the final Senate contest of the 2022 midterms, the challenges facing the party heading into the next campaign came into sharp relief.

title: Young voters’ enthusiasm for Democrats waned during midterms
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Young voters who have been critical to Democratic successes in recent elections showed signs in November’s midterms that their enthusiasm may be waning, a potential warning sign for a party that will need their strong backing heading into the 2024 presidential race.

title: Peru president proposes moving up elections amid protests
shortDescription: LIMA, Peru (AP) — Peru's newest president, Dina Boluarte, gave in to protesters' demands early Monday announcing in a nationally televised address that she will send Congress a proposal to move up elections.

title: Democratic lawmakers visit Havana, meet with Cuban president
shortDescription: HAVANA (AP) — A delegation of at least three U.S. lawmakers visited Havana and met with Cuba’s government this week, American and Cuban officials confirmed.Reps. James McGovern (D-MA), Mark Pocan (D-WI) and Troy Carter (D-LA) met with Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel, leaders in Cuba’s congress and its foreign minister, the U.S.

title: Kosovo postpones election in ethnic-Serb-dominated north
shortDescription: PRISTINA, Kosovo (AP) — Kosovo on Saturday postponed a local election due Dec. 18 in four municipalities with a predominantly ethnic Serb population, in an effort to defuse recent tensions there that have also caused relations with neighboring Serbia to deteriorate further.

title: Nobel Peace Prize winners blast Putin’s invasion of Ukraine
shortDescription: OSLO, Norway (AP) — The winners of this year's Nobel Peace Prize from Belarus, Russia and Ukraine shared their visions of a fairer world and denounced Russian President Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine during Saturday’s award ceremony in the Norwegian capital.

title: Effect of Georgia’s voting law unclear, despite high turnout
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Georgia’s 2022 election season ended dramatically this past week, but that was because of the closely watched Senate runoff that solidified Democratic control of the chamber and not for any large-scale problems with voting.

title: GOP sues over special elections in Pa. House majority battle
shortDescription: HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — The top-ranking Republican in the Pennsylvania House of Representatives asked a court late Friday to prevent voters from filling three vacant seats in February that will determine majority control of the chamber.

title: Rural voters ‘in the trenches’ on climate, leery of Biden
shortDescription: NEW YORK (AP) — Drought in California meant Raquel Krach, a rice farmer and graduate student in the Sacramento Valley, planted very little. Using groundwater, she and her husband planted 75 acres this year to maintain their markets.

title: Kari Lake challenges her defeat in Arizona governor’s race
shortDescription: PHOENIX (AP) — Kari Lake, the Republican defeated in Arizona governor’s race, is formally challenging her loss to Democrat Katie Hobbs, asking a court to throw out certified election results from the state's most populous county and either declare her the winner or rerun the governor's election in that county.

title: Trump lawyers in court for sealed hearing in Mar-a-Lago case
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Lawyers for Donald Trump were in court Friday for sealed arguments as part of the ongoing investigation into the presence of classified information at the former president's Florida estate.

title: US: Russia, Iran moving toward full defense ‘partnership’
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration is accusing Russia of moving to provide advanced military assistance to Iran, including air defense systems, helicopters and fighter jets, part of deepening cooperation between the two nations as Tehran provides drones to support Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Rioter who assaulted cops at Capitol gets 5 years in prison
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — A Tennessee man who authorities say came to Washington ahead of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot prepared for violence in a car full of weapons and assaulted officers who were trying to defend the Capitol was sentenced Friday to more than five years behind bars.

title: Democratic Sen. Kyrsten Sinema switches to independent
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democratic Sen. Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona announced Friday she has registered as an independent, a renegade move that could bolster her political brand but won't upend the Democrats' narrow Senate majority. She says she will not caucus with Republicans.

title: 1st Gen Z congressman-elect denied apartment over bad credit
shortDescription: WASHINGTON (AP) — Rep.-elect Maxwell Frost of Florida, the first member of Generation Z elected to Congress, says he is struggling to get an apartment in Washington and lost an application fee because his credit is “really bad.”

title: White House defends Brittney Griner swap with Russian arms dealer Bout
shortDescription: Brittney Griner returned to the United States after being detained in Russia since February. The White House is negotiating Paul Whelan's return.

title: Biden hopes to draw Africa closer during Washington summit despite China and Russia influence
shortDescription: President Biden would use the summit of African leaders to declare his support for adding the African Union as a permanent member of the G-20 nations.

title: Nonfatal opioid overdoses by state: White House launches new data map
shortDescription: The data dashboard on nonfatal opioid overdoses will target specific regions to help fight the epidemic, which left 81,000 dead in the US this year.

title: Did Georgia voting law affect midterm election turnout? It's not clear.
shortDescription: Civil rights groups said Georgia's new voting laws passed by the GOP-controlled legislature amounted to suppression, even as voter turnout peaked.

title: Democrats in 'tight spot' after Sinema's departure from national party
shortDescription: Political experts told USA TODAY that Sinema's move complicates Democrats' ability to hold onto the Arizona Senate seat, and Senate control, in 2024.

title: Supreme Court to hear First Amendment case on immigration fraud
shortDescription: The case arrives at the Supreme Court two years after the justices settled a similar dispute over the immigration law on procedural grounds.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried, ex-crypto exchange CEO, says he will testify before Congress
shortDescription: Sam Bankman-Fried said he's willing to testify Tuesday before a key congressional committee investigating the collapse of crypto exchange FTX.

title: Incoming member of Congress denied for DC apartment
shortDescription: Maxwell Frost made history as the first member of Gen Z to be elected to Congress.  That didn’t help him get an apartment in the nation’s capital.

title: What Sinema's announcement and Warnock's win mean for the Senate
shortDescription: Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock won a Georgia Senate runoff Tuesday. Days later, Arizona's Kyrsten Sinema said she was leaving the Democratic Party.

title: A shakeup in the Senate; Sinema switches party from Dem to independent
shortDescription: Sen. Kyrsten Sinema, who has voted with both parties, will keep her committee assignments, but wouldn't say if she will caucus with Democrats.

title: Biden criticized for Griner prison swap that left Paul Whelan in Russia
shortDescription: Critics question why former Marine Paul Whelan wasn't included in prisoner swap that freed Brittney Griner from Russian prison.

title: OnPolitics: House passes same-sex marriage bill, measure off to Biden
shortDescription: The Respect for Marriage Act is headed to President Joe Biden's desk after garnering bipartisan support in both congressional chambers.

title: House passes same-sex marriage bill, measure goes to Biden - live updates
shortDescription: The Respect for Marriage Act guarantees federal recognition of any marriage between two people if it was valid in the state where they were married.

title: House passes defense bill scrapping COVID vaccine mandate
shortDescription: The bill provides about $45 billion more for defense programs than Biden requested, the second year in a row Congress notably exceeded his request.

title: Indian Country Needs Money to Protect Its Wildlife Heritage. Congress Must Help.
shortDescription: Losses of animals and plants represent a fundamental threat to how Native peoples practice their religions and pass on their cultures.By Gloria Tom

title: Sinema Adds Intrigue and Democratic Fury to Arizona’s 2024 Senate Race
shortDescription: Senator Kyrsten Sinema’s announcement that she would become an independent left Democrats in her state, many of whom have long wanted to defeat her in a primary, facing a new political calculus.By Reid J. Epstein, Jennifer Medina and Katie Glueck

title: Leaders Back Away From Raising Debt Ceiling, Punting Clash to New Congress
shortDescription: Some Democrats had hoped to act on the issue before their party loses unified control of Congress, but a lack of political will and time appears to have sapped momentum for doing so.By Emily Cochrane

title: In D.C. With the First Gen-Z Congressman
shortDescription: Last month, Maxwell Frost, 25, was elected as the youngest member of the House. I followed him around during his first few weeks in D.C. as he settled into the Beltway.By Stephanie Lai

title: House Passes $858 Billion Defense Bill Repealing Vaccine Mandate for Troops
shortDescription: The legislation would rescind the coronavirus vaccine mandate in defiance of the Biden administration’s wishes, and increase the defense budget $45 billion over the president’s request.By Catie Edmondson

title: House Passes Bill to Protect Same-Sex Marriage
shortDescription: The House gave final approval to the Respect for Marriage Act with both sides voting in favor of the legislation, which provides federal recognition for same-sex marriages.By Reuters

title: Don’t worry, be a majority: Dems shrug off Sinema’s switch
shortDescription: Hours after Kyrsten Sinema publicly declared she'd switch her party to Independent, Democrats were already back to feeling reassured in their 51-seat majority.
